intro: Burdachia atractoides, commonly known as the Mexican burdachia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, while the flowers are yellow with a central disk. Burdachia atractoides is often found in rocky soils and can thrive in disturbed areas.
